page.title: 17Fakenham Country Day
page.content: Country day is the main annual fund raising event of Fakenham Lions Club. This year's profits go to help The Talking Times newspaper for the blind, Fakenham Day Centre and to buy equipment for Fakenham Surgery's Physiotherapy Dept. The event, in the centre of the racecourse, consists of Trade Stands, sideshows, craft stalls and Grand Ring displays. Country Day 1985 was opened by local TV personality and farmer, Dick Joice. The visiting celebrity was actor John Inman. Grand Ring events were a clown, an Alsation dog display team, an axe racing club, a band, an escapologist and a gun dog training display. Events that day also included the Fakenham Ten Mini Marathon, a goat show, a flower show, a small animal show, a golf competition, a clay pigeon shoot and a display of static engines.
